items.sentence: Tom bought a pair of cheap shoes, but they didn\'t last very long.

I didn\'t have any trouble convincing Tom to go to Boston with me.
Tom can\'t buy anything today, because he left his wallet at home.
There were twice as many university applicants in 1992 as in 1982.
Tom believed that the people in that small village were cannibals.
Tom could hear everything the people in the next room were saying.
Tom is going to lose his job if he keeps showing up late for work.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom doesn\'t want to go to Boston with Mary.
